title: SPA with client-side routing — dynamic route discovery
query: Audit my React app at http://localhost:3000 for accessibility
setup: Target is a Next.js SPA. Pages are rendered client-side via React Router. The sitemap.xml does not exist. The homepage links to /products, /about, /contact, and /checkout via client-side <Link> components.
expected_behavior: When sitemap is not found, falls back to Crawler automatically and informs the user
Uses Playwright to crawl client-side navigations — does NOT only scan static HTML links
Detects Next.js framework via DOM signals or package.json and loads framework-specific guidance
Discovers at least /products, /about, /contact pages via client-side navigation
Does NOT treat all SPA routes as a single page audit
Reports findings per route, not aggregated across the full SPA as one finding
Deduplicates cross-page findings (same component appearing on multiple routes counted once)

model_notes.all_agents: Critical: SPA discovery requires Playwright JS execution — verify the agent does not fall back to static HTML parsing for link discovery.
